name: Can You Help Me Find a Country? Quiz | Geography | 10 Questions

questions.text: Do you think you can adapt to blizzards and reindeer?
questions.explanation:
Canada.

	Canada is one of the largest countries on the planet. It has both English and French as national languages and is one of the most multi-cultural nations in the world. It is home to plentiful natural resources and has well-developed trade networks. Canada is one of the wealthiest countries in the world and provides its citizens with one of the highest standards of living in the world.

questions.text: When riding in a rickshaw in the wind I always wear a bonnet.
questions.explanation:
India.

	India is the second most populous country in the world and the seventh largest by area. It is home to many religions including Buddhism, Hinduism, Jainism, and Sikhism. This large country is home to many types of ecosystems and many different types of wildlife. India also has great mineral resources and is moving into the 21st century at a steady pace.

questions.text: Before we went to see St. Basils with Russ, I asked his mother for some vodka.
questions.explanation:
Russia.

	Geographically one of the largest countries in the world, Russia is one of the few countries to be located on two continents, Europe and Asia. They have large deposits of coal, oil, and natural gas, as well as numerous types of gemstones. Russia is home to steppe, tundra, mountains, and extensive coastlines on the Arctic and Pacific Oceans. The lakes of Russia are numerous and contain approximately 1/4 of the world's liquid fresh water.

questions.text: When I fell off the wall in the Forbidden City and scraped my chin against the wall, I vowed never to return.
questions.explanation:
China.

	The People's Republic of China, usually known simply as China, is the most populated country on the planet. One of the largest countries on the planet, it has very diverse ecosystems and is home to many endangered and unique species of animals. China is often credited with the invention of paper, gunpowder, printing and the compass.

questions.text: While searching for Yeti I took my one pal with me for protection.
questions.explanation:
Nepal.

	The landlocked nation of Nepal is located in southern Asia. A mountainous country, Nepal is home to eight of the planet's ten tallest mountains. Agricultural endeavors provide work for the vast majority of the population. The natural beauty of the country has given rise to a growing tourism industry. The difficult landscape of Nepal also makes it home to many animals who rarely leave the mountains and are indigenous only to those areas.

questions.text: When he drinks beer, he has problems with nausea and anger, many nights.
questions.explanation:
Germany.

	One of the largest countries in Europe, Germany is home to dense forests, majestic mountains, and the lowlands found in the northern part of the country. The country is home to mineral reserves such as iron, coal, uranium, copper, and nickel. Wild boar, deer, fox and badgers all make their homes in Germany along with many other types of wildlife.

questions.text: After we visited the spa in the mountains, it was time for some wine and cheese.
questions.explanation:
Spain.

	The beautiful country of Spain takes up most of the Iberian Peninsula and has coastlines on both the Atlantic Ocean and the Mediterranean Sea. This Catholic nation has left its imprint all over the world, as can be seen by the numerous Spanish speaking nations in both North and South America. Spain is a mountainous country with numerous large rivers. Tourism and agriculture are the largest industries in the country, followed by the production of both wind and solar power.

questions.text: After we got warm on the den, Mark decided that it was time to play in the snow.
questions.explanation:
Denmark.

	The country of Denmark consists of most of the Jutland peninsula, hundreds of small islands, and the large island of Greenland. This seafaring nation has a high standard of life and is often cited at the happiest country in the world. Denmark is very eco-friendly and a leader in the study of global warming and climate change. Denmark has a healthy, mixed economy and is a world leader in the field of alternate fuels, and computer software.

questions.text: With new zeal and excitement, we decided to go searching for kakapo.
questions.explanation:
New Zealand.

	The unique nation of New Zealand is a wonderful place, full of unique flora and fauna. Because of the remote location of this island nation, it was one of the last land masses to be settled by humans. The indigenous Maori culture did not make contact with European explorers until 1642. The picturesque landscape of the island has led to it being used as the backdrop for many modern films. It is also a reason that the tourism industry is so very successful.

questions.text: Alec had many problems with his equipment during our safari.
questions.explanation:
Chad.

	Chad is a landlocked nation in the center of Africa. It has official languages of French and Arabic. The largest city, and also its capital, is N'Djamena which is located in the southwest corner of the country. Chad is home to many different types of ecosystems including desert, savanna, wetlands, and mountains.
